function.description: Returns the base-64 encoded string of file file. Commonly used to encode binary data for transfer over a text channel (such as attachments in e-mails). The parameter file is expected to be either a valid file name, or a binary variable.

examples.example: Return NULL. Decodes the provided string and writes the following to the textfile text.txt: <note> <to>Tove</to> <from>Jani</from> <heading>Reminder</heading> <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body> </note>
